page.title: 05A DAY IN THE LIFE OF A MINER
page.content: I AM A MINER AND WORK UNDERGROUND AS A FITTER.I TRAVEL TO WORK OUTSIDE THE VALLEY BECAUSE THE LAST MINE IN THE VALLEY WAS CLOSED IN 1983.MY SHIFT BEGINS AT 6:30 AM AND LASTS FOR 7 1/4 HOURS.WHEN I ARRIVE AT THE PIT I GO TO THE PITHEAD BATHS TO CHANGE INTO MY WORKING CLOTHES.FROM THERE I GO TO THE LAMP-ROOM TO COLLECT MY LAMP AND GIVE MY"CHECK"TO SHOW I AM GOING UNDERGROUND.I DESCEND THE PIT SHAFT IN A CAGE,WHICH IS LOWERED ON A ROPE CONNECTED TO A WINDING ENGINE.WHEN I ARRIVE AT PIT BOTTOM,I TRAVEL TO THE FACE BY LOCOMOTIVE AND HAVE TO WALK THE LAST PART OF THE JOURNEY.AT THE FACE I REPAIR COAL CUTTING MACHINES OR CONVEYOR BELTS.I HAVE WORKED UNDERGROUND FOR 20 YEARS.
